You NEED to get the 'Criterion Collection' version - it is one of 
the best done DVDs I've ever seen.  It has English subtitles 
(optional) and the best commentary track I've ever heard.  It has 
also been remastered, and looks far more crisp than any prior 
version.

http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0780020685/104-4493474-
3183960?vi=glance

Criterion also did a new DVD version of "rashomon", and that is not 
only excellent, but it also has an English dubbed track that 
(shockingly) is perfect! (I almost always despise English dubbing on 
Japanese movies) So I'd also recommend Rashomon from Criterion.  I 
just can't wait until RAN gets done by Criterion.  The existing DVD 
for RAN is the most pathetic and disapointing DVD transfer I've ever 
seen, no option to turn off the subtitles, and no quality 
restoration for the picture or sound...!





--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, Howard Beasley <howard@b...> 
wrote:
>  Hi,
> 
> Does anyone know if there is a definitive version of the Seven 
Samurai to 
> get on DVD (english subtitles), what it is and where to get it 
please...I 
> keep seeing versions with different play times on the websites 
with R2 some 
> 20 minutes short on R1 in some cases.  There seem to be several 
different 
> versions available although that may be the add ons rather than 
cuts for 
> the different licencing regimes.
> 
> I was blown away the first time I saw this film...I have other 
films where 
> there are clear cuts for violence which annoy me because they're 
so obvious 
> and I don't recall them having been there before...eg in one film 
a rider 
> being toppled off a fallen horse is missing because they thought 
the UK 
> public would find it distressing....(it wasn't hurt apparently).  
He's 
> shown getting up but the incident is missing here...but not in the 
US.
> 
> I don't want my memory of this film to be tainted in a similar 
way...I'm in 
> the UK but have a Multi Region player.
> 
> Thanks
> 
> Howard
